intro: Pentacalia chulumanica, commonly known as the Chulumanica morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as a vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blossoms that open in the morning. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its beauty and unique flowering pattern.
